name: Longitudinal connectivity
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Degree to which residual pools and riffle segments remain linked by continuous surface flow along the thalweg at normal low flow.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Walk the reach at low flow; count pools and note whether each connects to the next by surface flow. Map continuous wetted thalweg and dry gaps; confirm with late-season imagery and shallow-sill checks.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Long dry segments; pools isolated.
Criteria: <25% connected; no continuous surface flow.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Several dry gaps; many pools isolated.
Criteria: About 25-50% connected; riffles mostly dry.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some dry gaps but many pools still linked.
Criteria: About 50-75% of pools connected with short dry gaps.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Most residual pools connected with continuous wetted thalweg.
Criteria: >75% of pools connected; few or no dry gaps.
